alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; De Baca County; Eastern Lincoln County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 5:18PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN LINCOLN, SOUTHWESTERN DE BACA AND NORTHWESTERN CHAVES COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM MDT... At 518 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles southwest of Ramon, or 34 miles southeast of Corona, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Lincoln, southwestern De Baca and northwestern Chaves Counties. This includes Highway 285 between Mile Markers 159 and 172. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; De Baca County; Eastern Lincoln County
